content.text:
# List of canal junctions in the United Kingdom

This List of canal junctions in the United Kingdom is an incomplete list of canal junctions in the United Kingdom that have articles in Wikipedia, in alphabetical order.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Junction
! Canals
! Location
! Image
|-
| Aldersley Junction, West Midlands
| The Birmingham Main Line Canal terminates here.
It meets the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal near Oxley, Wolverhampton, and one kilometre south of Autherley Junction.
|
|
|-
| Aston Junction, West Midlands
| Birmingham and Fazeley Canal, Digbeth Branch Canal
|
|
|-
| Autherley Junction, West Midlands
| Shropshire Union Canal, Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal
|
|
|-
| Barbridge Junction
| The Shropshire Union Canal Middlewich Branch terminates here. It meets the Shropshire Union Canal Main Line
|
|
|-
| Birchills Junction
| Walsall Canal, Wyrley and Essington Canal main line
|
|
|-
| Bordesley Junction, West Midlands
| Grand Union Canal splits into mainline and north-east arm
|
|
|-
| Bromford Junction, West Midlands
| BCN New Main Line, Spon Lane Locks Branch
|
|
|-
| Catshill Junction
| Wyrley and Essington Canal main line, Daw End Branch Canal
|
|
|-
| Dukinfield Junction, Greater Manchester
| Ashton Canal, Peak Forest Canal
|
|
|-
| Fazeley Junction, Staffordshire
| Birmingham and Fazeley Canal, Coventry Canal
|
|
|-
| Fradley Junction, Staffordshire
| Coventry Canal, Trent and Mersey Canal
|
|
|-
| Frankton Junction, Shropshire
| Montgomery Canal, Llangollen Canal
|
|
|-
| Hardings Wood Junction, Staffordshire
| Macclesfield Canal (Hall Green Branch), Trent and Mersey Canal
|
|
|-
| Hawkesbury Junction, Warwickshire
| Oxford Canal, Coventry Canal
|
|
|-
| Haywood Junction, Staffordshire
| Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal, Trent and Mersey Canal
|
|
|-
| Horseley Fields Junction, West Midlands
| BCN Main Line, Wyrley and Essington Canal
|
|
|-
| Huddlesford Junction, Staffordshire
| Coventry Canal, Wyrley and Essington Canal
|
|
|-
| Hurleston Junction, Cheshire
| Llangollen Canal, Shropshire Union Canal main line
|
|
|-
| Kings Norton Junction
| Stratford-upon-Avon Canal, Worcester and Birmingham Canal
|
|
|-
| Kingswood Junction
| Stratford-upon-Avon Canal, Grand Union Canal
|
|
|-
| Browning's Pool, Little Venice, London
| Grand Union Canal, Regent's Canal
|
|
|-
| Marple Junction
| Macclesfield Canal, Peak Forest Canal
|
|
|-
| Norbury Junction
| Birmingham and Liverpool Junction Canal (later Shropshire Union Canal), and branch linking to Shrewsbury Canal
|
|
|-
| Ogley Junction
| On the Wyrley and Essington Canal where the Anglesey Branch leaves the main line
|
|
|-
| Old Turn Junction
| The Birmingham and Fazeley Canal meets the BCN Main Line
|
|
|-
| Pelsall Junction
| Southern limit of the Cannock Extension Canal where it meets the Wyrley and Essington Canal main line
|
|
|-
| Rumer Hill Junction
| Former junction - now lost - on the Cannock Extension Canal where the Churchbridge Branch left to join the Hatherton Canal
|
|
|-
| Rushall Junction
| Southern limit of the Rushall Canal where it meets the Tame Valley Canal
|
|
|-
| Salford Junction
| The Grand Union Canal and Tame Valley Canal meet the Birmingham and Fazeley Canal
|
|
|-
| Smethwick Junction
| The junction of the BCN Old Main Line and the BCN New Main Line
|
|
|-
| Spon Lane Junction
| Originally the junction of the Birmingham Canal (proceeding south-west and east) and the Wednesbury Canal (proceeding west), this now forms the junction at the top of the "canal slip road" down to the BCN New Main Line (proceeding west) and the BCN Old Main Line (proceeding south-west and east).
|
|
|-
| Stockingfield Junction
| Originally a terminus it became the junction for the Glasgow Branch of the Forth and Clyde Canal in 1777 running to Port Dundas via Spiers Wharf by 1790. The Monkland Canal joined the branch at the Port Dundas basin.
|
|
|-
| Tame Valley Junction
| Western limit of the Tame Valley Canal where it meets the Walsall Canal
|
|
|-
| Wappenshall Junction
| The Newport Branch Canal joins the Shrewsbury Canal. The canals here are no longer navigable but the junction still exists.
|
|
|}

*Canals of Great Britain
